recommendations.summary: Safe to irrigate with modified management
recommendations.detailed_message: Upper Karabakh Canal water is showing EC levels of 0.85 dS/m, which is slightly above the ideal threshold for sweet corn (0.7 dS/m). Irrigation can continue, but monitor crop closely for any signs of stress.

actions.details: Apply 15% extra water during each irrigation event to help flush salts below the root zone
Apply agricultural gypsum to help displace sodium and improve soil structure
Use handheld EC meter to check irrigation water daily during high temperature periods

recommendations.summary: Avoid using for most crops without treatment
recommendations.detailed_message: Well water has severe salinity (EC: 3.24 dS/m) and sodium hazard (SAR: 10.2). Using this water directly risks soil structure degradation and yield loss in most crops.

actions.description: Switch to canal water if available
actions.details: Use Upper Karabakh Canal water instead of well water for irrigation

actions.description: Blend with canal water at 1:2 ratio
actions.details: If well water must be used, blend 1 part well water with 2 parts canal water to dilute salts
Apply agricultural gypsum to counteract sodium and maintain soil structure
For fields exclusively using this water source, consider barley, cotton, or tall wheatgrass which have higher salt tolerance

recommendations.detailed_message: Mingachevir Reservoir water quality is excellent with EC at 0.52 dS/m and all other parameters within optimal ranges. No restrictions for any crops.

actions.details: Continue with standard weekly water quality checks

recommendations.detailed_message: Soil tests and canal water analysis indicate elevated nitrate levels. Current cotton growth stage requires reduced nitrogen to prevent excessive vegetative growth and delayed maturity.

actions.details: Decrease next scheduled nitrogen application from 60 kg/ha to 42 kg/ha
Avoid waterlogging which can lead to nitrogen leaching and groundwater contamination
